subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Fast Followers: The Art of Strategic Patience
description: A micro-lesson that makes Fast Followers: The Art of Strategic Patience usable.

hook.text: Microsoft didn't create the spreadsheetâ€”VisiCalc did. Microsoft watched, waited, and then launched Excel.

buildup.text: Excel studied every complaint about existing spreadsheets and fixed them all on day one.

discovery.text: Fast followers have a secret weapon: they can see what customers actually want, not what founders guessed.

twist.text: Samsung studied the iPhone for years before releasing the Galaxy. They added features Apple had deliberately skipped.

climax.text: By 2012, Samsung outsold Apple in smartphones worldwide. Patience and observation beat first-mover status.

punchline.text: Smart companies let others build the road, then drive faster.

quiz.question: What key advantage do fast followers have over first movers?
options: They always have more funding available from investors
They can observe real customer reactions and fix the first mover's mistakes
They benefit from weaker competition since the market is established
